segment.source: VPN profile options (Windows 10)
segment.target: VPN profile options (Windows 10)

segment.source: Virtual private networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.
segment.target: Virtual private networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.

segment.source: Windows 10 adds useful new VPN profile options to help you manage how users connect.
segment.target: Windows 10 adds useful new VPN profile options to help you manage how users connect.

segment.source: VPN profile options
segment.target: VPN profile options

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Virtual private networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.
segment.target: Virtual private networks (VPN) let you give your users secure remote access to your company network.

segment.source: Windows 10 adds useful new VPN profile options to help you manage how users connect.
segment.target: Windows 10 adds useful new VPN profile options to help you manage how users connect.

segment.source: Always On
segment.target: Always On

segment.source: Always On is a new feature in Windows 10 which enables the active VPN profile to connect automatically on the following triggers:
segment.target: Always On is a new feature in Windows 10 which enables the active VPN profile to connect automatically on the following triggers:

segment.source: User sign-on
segment.target: User sign-on

segment.source: Network change
segment.target: Network change

segment.source: When a device has multiple profiles with Always On triggers, the user can specify the active profile in SettingsNetwork & InternetVPNVPN profileLet apps automatically use this VPN connection.
segment.target: When a device has multiple profiles with Always On triggers, the user can specify the active profile in SettingsNetwork & InternetVPNVPN profileLet apps automatically use this VPN connection.

segment.source: App-triggered VPN
segment.target: App-triggered VPN

segment.source: VPN profiles in Windows 10 can be configured to connect automatically on the launch of a specified set of applications.
segment.target: VPN profiles in Windows 10 can be configured to connect automatically on the launch of a specified set of applications.

segment.source: This feature was included in Windows 8.1 as "On demand VPN".
segment.target: This feature was included in Windows 8.1 as "On demand VPN".

segment.source: The applications can be defined using the following:
segment.target: The applications can be defined using the following:

segment.source: Package family name for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Package family name for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: File path for Classic Windows applications
segment.target: File path for Classic Windows applications

segment.source: Traffic filters
segment.target: Traffic filters

segment.source: Traffic Filters give enterprises the ability to decide what traffic is allowed into the corporate network based on policy .
segment.target: Traffic Filters give enterprises the ability to decide what traffic is allowed into the corporate network based on policy .

segment.source: With the ever-increasing landscape of remote threats on the corporate network and lesser IT controls on machines, it becomes essential to control the traffic that is allowed through.
segment.target: With the ever-increasing landscape of remote threats on the corporate network and lesser IT controls on machines, it becomes essential to control the traffic that is allowed through.

segment.source: While server-side layers of firewalls and proxies help, by adding traffic filters the first layer of filtering can be moved onto the client with more advanced filtering on the server side.
segment.target: While server-side layers of firewalls and proxies help, by adding traffic filters the first layer of filtering can be moved onto the client with more advanced filtering on the server side.

segment.source: There are two types of Traffic Filter rules:
segment.target: There are two types of Traffic Filter rules:

segment.source: App-based rules.
segment.target: App-based rules.

segment.source: With app-based rules, a list of applications can be marked such that only traffic originating from these apps is allowed to go over the VPN interface.
segment.target: With app-based rules, a list of applications can be marked such that only traffic originating from these apps is allowed to go over the VPN interface.

segment.source: Traffic-based rules.
segment.target: Traffic-based rules.

segment.source: Traffic-based rules are 5-tuple policies (ports, addresses, protocol) that can be specified such that only traffic matching these rules is allowed to go over the VPN interface.
segment.target: Traffic-based rules are 5-tuple policies (ports, addresses, protocol) that can be specified such that only traffic matching these rules is allowed to go over the VPN interface.

segment.source: There can be many sets of rules which are linked by OR.
segment.target: There can be many sets of rules which are linked by OR.

segment.source: Within each set, there can be app-based rules and traffic-based rules; all the properties within the set will be linked by AND.
segment.target: Within each set, there can be app-based rules and traffic-based rules; all the properties within the set will be linked by AND.

segment.source: This gives the IT admins a lot of power to craft the perfect policy befitting their use case.
segment.target: This gives the IT admins a lot of power to craft the perfect policy befitting their use case.

segment.source: LockDown VPN
segment.target: LockDown VPN

segment.source: A VPN profile configured with LockDown secures the device to only allow network traffic over the VPN interface.
segment.target: A VPN profile configured with LockDown secures the device to only allow network traffic over the VPN interface.

segment.source: It has the following features:
segment.target: It has the following features:

segment.source: The system attempts to keep the VPN connected at all times.
segment.target: The system attempts to keep the VPN connected at all times.

segment.source: The user cannot disconnect the VPN connection.
segment.target: The user cannot disconnect the VPN connection.

segment.source: The user cannot delete or modify the VPN profile.
segment.target: The user cannot delete or modify the VPN profile.

segment.source: The VPN LockDown profile uses forced tunnel connection.
segment.target: The VPN LockDown profile uses forced tunnel connection.

segment.source: If the VPN connection is not available, outbound network traffic is blocked.
segment.target: If the VPN connection is not available, outbound network traffic is blocked.

segment.source: Only one VPN LockDown profile is allowed on a device.
segment.target: Only one VPN LockDown profile is allowed on a device.

segment.source: Note: For inbox VPN, Lockdown VPN is only available for the Internet Key Exchange version 2 (IKEv2) tunnel type.
segment.target: Note: For inbox VPN, Lockdown VPN is only available for the Internet Key Exchange version 2 (IKEv2) tunnel type.
